meanings.definition: Make (guilt or an offense) seem less serious or more forgivable.
meanings.sent1: She tried to extenuate her mistake by apologizing sincerely.
meanings.sent2: His remorseful attitude extenuates the severity of his actions.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's adorable face extenuates the mess he made.
meanings.sent4: Her genuine remorse extenuates the impact of her error.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt apology extenuates the hurt feelings.

meanings.sent1: The illness extenuated his once robust physique.
meanings.sent2: The lack of food extenuates the starving child's condition.
meanings.sent3: Skipping meals won't extenuate your weight loss goals.
meanings.sent4: The intense training regimen extenuates the athlete's body.
meanings.sent5: The prolonged illness extenuates his already slim frame.
